0.text: I'm on Windows and my PC is slow

1.text: Is your Windows partition full (usually the C disk), is there less than 5 GB available?

2.text:
Please clean your disk to free up space.
You can take contact with the E-kot for more information.

3.text: Check the programs that run when the PC starts up.

4.text:
Please press ctrl + shift + escape (or escape) simultaneously to open the Task Manager,
then in the Startup tab, check what is ticked and remove anything you don't need

5.text: You can clean your computer by deleting certain files that have become obsolete.

6.text:
You can install adwcleaner, available for free by this link.
Once installed, you can launch the analysis via the dashboard, the cleaning is done automatically

7.text: Make your internet browsing more appropriate by changing your browser settings.

8.text: Which web browser do you mainly use?

9.text:
Check that there is not too much content on your desktop, this may slow down the start up.
If you have an SSD + HDD, please put only the necessary on the ssd for a faster boot

10.text: I no longer have Google as my homepage.

11.text:
To reset Google correctly, please go to the browser settings, then go to 'Search Engine',
click on 'Search engine used in the address bar' and choose Google

12.text: I have unusual pages when I launch my browser

13.text:
Please go to the browser settings, then in 'On startup',
choose either 'Open the New Tab Page' or choose the page(s) you want in 'Open a specific page or set of pages'

14.text: Is your new tab page the one you want?

15.text:
Please go to your browser options, then 'Home',
click to the right of 'New Tabs' and choose the new tab page you want.

16.text: Is your page at the start of the browser the one you want?

17.text: Please go to browser options, then 'Home', click on the right hand side of 'Homepage and new windows' and choose what you want

18.text: VIs your search engine the one you want?

19.text: Please go to the browser options, then in 'Search', choose the search engine you are interested in in 'Default Search Engine'
